head.title: National Editor Named by The Times

hedline.hl1: National Editor Named by The Times

abstract.p: Katherine J Roberts is appointed national editor of The New York Times; succeeds Dean Baquet, who moved to The Los Angeles Times to become managing editor (S)

block.p: The appointment of Katherine J. Roberts as national editor of The New York Times was announced yesterday by Joseph Lelyveld, the executive editor. It will take effect after Election Day.
Ms. Roberts, 48, has been editor of the Op-Ed page of The Times since 1995. In her new post, she succeeds Dean Baquet, who moved to The Los Angeles Times in July as managing editor.
The appointment of Katherine J. Roberts as national editor of The New York Times was announced yesterday by Joseph Lelyveld, the executive editor. It will take effect after Election Day.
Ms. Roberts, 48, has been editor of the Op-Ed page of The Times since 1995. In her new post, she succeeds Dean Baquet, who moved to The Los Angeles Times in July as managing editor.

Ms. Roberts joined The Times in 1982. She has been deputy editor of the Week in Review, an articles editor of The Times Magazine, deputy editor of the Op-Ed page and an assistant national editor. She is a graduate of the University of California at Santa Cruz and has a master's degree in journalism and Russian studies from Indiana University.
Before joining The Times, Ms. Roberts was an editorial writer and deputy editorial page editor at The Minneapolis Star.
